intro: Gnaphalium coquimbense, commonly known as the Coquimbo feathergrass, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, fluffy flowers are often arranged in dense clusters, giving it a distinctive, feathery appearance. Gnaphalium coquimbense is also noted for its aromatic leaves, which release a subtle scent when crushed.
